body:
I can confirm this is happening on `Rails 3.1.rc5` and `Rails 3.1.rc6` though not in `Rails 3.0.x`.

The issue does seem to stem from improper loading of the Parent table name. For example, say Parent declares a `has_one` relation to a Widget model for all children. The following seed data throws a table missing error (table named as Parent). 

    child1 = Child1.create(...)
    child1.create_widget(...)
    child2 = Child2.create(...)
    child2.create_widget(...)

Where the following sequence works as expected. 

    child1 = Child1.create(...)
    child2 = Child2.create(...)
    child1.create_widget(...)
    child2.create_widget(...)

If I monkey patch the `table_name` method in each Child model, both sequences work as expected.
